b'Hopefully there\xe2\x80\x99s a great show goin\xe2\x80\x99 on up there tonight to welcome you!
 
We\xe2\x80\x99ll miss you Jonny!
James, Lars, Kirk & Robert

(5/5)'
b'We hope they will be able to take some comfort in knowing that he is reunited with Marsha, and that he helped bring so much incredible music to so many. \n\n(4/5)'
b'Our love and sympathy go out to Jonny\xe2\x80\x99s children and his grandchildren, whom he cherished and brought to our shows from the time they were in diapers.\n\n(3/5)'
b'He was a mentor, a manager, a label head and a father figure to us all . . . Metallica would not be who we are or where we are today without Jon Zazula and his wife, Marsha. \n\n(2/5)'

b'Heavy music lost one of its great champions today when Jonny Z left this world far too soon.   In 1982, when no one wanted to take a chance on four kids from California playing a crazy brand of metal, Jonny and Marsha did, and the rest, as they say, is history.\n\n(1/5) https://t.co/W0IdaIf4Zt'

\xc2\xa0
Learn more about Victorian Country Fire Authority and how you can help\xc2\xa0\xe2\x9e\xa1\xef\xb8\x8f\xc2\xa0https://t.co/nZLEdOqDjK 

(6/6)'

b'@CFA_Updates is a volunteer and community-based fire and emergency services organization which helps to protect 3.3 million Victorians, and works together with communities to keep Victorians safe from fire and other emergencies. (5/6)'

b'@NSWRFS is the world\xe2\x80\x99s largest volunteer firefighting organization and all funds donated during this State of Emergency are directed toward services related to and victims of these particularly destructive Australian bushfires. (4/6)'

b'Please join us and do whatever you can to assist as we, along with our @AWMHFoundation, are pledging A$750,000 to the NSW Rural Fire Service and to the Country Fire Authority in Victoria to aid in the relief efforts. (3/6)'
b'The resulting destruction and devastating effects on all residents, animals, the environment and the incredible land in Australia is truly heartbreaking. (2/6)'
b'We are totally overwhelmed by the news of the wildfires sweeping through millions of acres across Australia, with major impact in New South Wales and Victoria. (1/6) https://t.co/XqJAHmN6um'

(6/6) https://t.co/S6ftfUKQjV'
b'Whether you are able to contribute money, non-perishable food, clothing and other supplies, or your time by volunteering or providing temporary housing, every bit helps.\n\n(5/6)'
b'We would also like to encourage you to join us in supporting those in need as well as the first responders who have been working tirelessly to keep Californians safe. \n\n(4/6)'
b'Both organizations are dedicated to long-term recovery efforts, helping residents resume normal lives as they get back on their feet after the devastation of these firestorms. \n\n(3/6)'

b'The @AWMHFoundation would like to lend support to those affected in both Northern and Southern California by donating $100,000 to assist in relief, $50,000 to the Sonoma County Resilience Fund and $50,000 to the Wildfire Relief Fund.\n\n(2/6)'
b'Sadly, for the third year in a row, communities we have called home throughout the state of California are again experiencing the tragedy left in the wake of wildfires. \n\n(1/6)'

(6/6)'
b'All tickets purchased to the shows in Australia and New Zealand, including Enhanced Experiences and Black Tickets, will be fully refunded. \xc2\xa0\n\n(5/6)'

b'Once again, we are devastated that we have inconvenienced so many of you, especially our most loyal fans who travel great distances to experience our shows. We appreciate your understanding and support for James &  thank you for being a part of our\xc2\xa0Metallica\xc2\xa0family. \n\n(4/6)'
b'We fully intend to make our way to your part of the world as soon as health and schedule permit. We\xe2\x80\x99ll let you know as soon as we can. \n\n(3/6)'

b'As most of you probably know, our brother James has been struggling with addiction on and off for many years. He has now, unfortunately, had to re-enter a treatment program to work on his recovery again.\xc2\xa0\n\n(2/6)'

b'A Note from Lars, Kirk, and Rob

We are truly sorry to inform our fans and friends that we must postpone our upcoming tour of Australia and New Zealand.

(1/6)'

b'And judging by the smile on his face whenever we were together, we think the feeling was mutual. Rest In Peace, Dave. (4/4)'

b'In his passion for his craft, we found a truly kindred soul - Dave lived to see people enjoy what he created, and we enjoyed every minute of our collaboration on our Blackened Whiskey with him. (3/4)'
b'We learned so much from Dave in the all too brief time we had together. But more than anything, Dave was our good friend and we will miss him tremendously. (2/4)'

b'The Metallica family is stunned and in disbelief at the loss of our friend and partner, Dave Pickerell. He was not only a mentor and friend, we considered him a member of Metallica. (1/4) https://t.co/sQvQsvBuf1'
